name: eurasian
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A Eurasian person has one European parent and one Asian parent: I know not to judge people based on race because I'm Eurasian and I constantly get asked where I'm from.
of or connected with Europe and Asia considered as a unit: Eurasian languages Eurasian migratory birds
More examplesFewer examplesI’m originally from Hong Kong, live in Scotland, and call myself British and Eurasian, and see absolutely no contradiction in doing so.One of the housemates looks Eurasian.The "gatekeeper" is a Eurasian butterfly that has bright orange wings with a brown border. Eurasian eagle owls are larger than their North American cousins.India was established as one of five great powers on the Eurasian continent in the 21st century. America was starting to take a joint Eurasian approach to its policies in Europe and Asia.
a person with one European parent and one Asian parent: Malaysia has a rich ethnic blend of Malay, Chinese, Indians, and Eurasians, living side by side.
More examplesFewer examplesThe island has Chinese and Hindu temples, Muslim mosques, and Christian churches for its Eurasians and Westerners.Three main groups influenced the food of Singapore — Perankans, Malaysians, and Eurasians.
